
Assumptions used in Calculation of Energy Bill	
In general, the bill is the sum of hourly volume * hourly price for the various categories	
(1)  Expost price is average of hourly SP15 and NP15 expost prices	
(2)  Expost volume is the sum of instructed expost generation, interchange, and load volumes	
(3)  Day ahead PX price is the average of the hourly SP15 and NP15 PX day ahead zonal prices	
(4)  Day ahead PX volume is the clearing volume reported in the Unconstrained PX Day Ahead Market	
(5)  Ancillary service volumes are summed across all ISO zones	
(6)  Ancillary service prices are averaged across all zones with non-zero prices in a given hourly interval	
(7)  Ancillary service costs represent the regulation, spin, non-spin, and replacement reserve capacity markets	
(8)  Day ahead and hour ahead capacity payments are included in the ancillary service bill with the hour ahead 	
       volume equalling the difference between the volumes reported by the ISO for the day ahead and hour	
       markets (because the hour ahead volume is reported as the cumulative sum by the ISO)	
       (see Assumption 5 also).	
(9)  Hour ahead PX Market energy bill is not included in this summary	
(10) Any energy scheduled day ahead outside the PX Market is not represented in this summary	PXDayAheadBill
ExpostBill
AncillaryServiceBill
Monthly Energy Bill
